snippet: In an age of austerity, governments are increasingly reluctant to continue a perk workers see as a reward for a lifetime of service.
abstract: Lawsuit filed against the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey after it eliminated free tolls and airport parking for 3,900 retirees raises questions of whether such public sector perks can survive in this era of austerity.
lead_paragraph: In an age of austerity, governments are increasingly reluctant to continue a perk workers see as a reward for a lifetime of service.
